project_abstract.cdata: The Emergency Recovery Grant Project will support the restoration of assets and production, following the drought-induced emergency in early 2005, through the financing of private sector imports necessary to an effective recovery program. The main objective will be to finance imports, critical to the recovery of investment and production; counterpart funds will be transferred to the approved budget, and thereby contribute to the financing of the Government's poverty reduction strategy. However, among the major risks is the impact of the crisis, which may be larger than anticipated, placing continued pressure on imports, such that investment, production, and exports may fail to recover quickly; that the next agricultural season may also be affected by adverse weather conditions which may undermine an economic recovery.
